free: #e Greetings, everyone
#c 大家好。

gloss: 感謝-這第一人稱單數.附著主格
名物化-結婚-名物化=第一人稱複數(包含).附著屬格
free: #e Thanks to this opportunity, I need to say that our wedding ceremony, (in) Rukai, is very important.
#c 感謝這次機會，我要說魯凱族的婚禮是很重要的。
#e It is important to obey the elders for having a family.
#c 要建立家庭，聽從老人是很重要的。
#e Rukai people would like to get married.
#c 如果魯凱族人想結婚。

gloss: 做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化

free: #e If (male and female family) talked to each other and (they) accepted the engagement, the loving ceremony would not be easy since the engagement was made.
#c 如果(男女雙方)互談並答應，自訂下婚約時起，戀愛儀式就不簡單。
#e If (two families need a ceremony, (they) should give gifts and (they) dine together; (their) heart will be close
#c 如果(雙方)要完成儀式，(他們)就要互相送禮然後他們聚餐。他們的心要貼近。
#e Then, (the male family) should be asked to the female mamily.
#c 然後，(男方) 就要被請到女方家。
#e If the female family responded, (they) would discuss about the dowry in the wedding ceremony.
#c 若女方回應，就可以開始談結婚要準備的聘禮。

gloss: 互相-重疊-達成-名物化=完成
做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化
free: #e This way, if (they) mutually achieved, from the time (they) need to prepare the dowry…
#c 這樣，如果(他們)互相做到了，從(他們)要準備聘禮。

gloss: 做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化

free: #e Dowry is the “dinghun” in Taiwanese.
#c 這tuasiasilangane就是台灣人的訂婚。

gloss: 做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化

free: #e If the male makes the engagement, the dowry will be very important
#c 如果男方要準備聘禮，那是相當重要的。

gloss: 做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化

free: #e While (they) preparing the dowry, elders discussed about the necessity items of the dowry mutually.
#c 當(他們)準備聘禮時，老人家互相談論必備的聘禮物品。
#e (elders) discussed this.
#c (老人)互相討論這個。

gloss: 做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化

free: #e In the ancient time, engagement would take a very long time; they discussed and then got married.
#c 在以前，訂婚要花很長的時間;(他們)討論然後結婚。
#e Then, if (a marriage) is (arranged) in a hurry, then the spirit of (the two families) will have no connection.
#c 然後，若(婚禮)草率(決定)，(雙方)靈魂將會沒有連結。

gloss: 做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化

free: #e After they discussed, (the two families) can make engagement, and (they) milled millet, and (they) have wedding ceremony.
#c (雙方)討論後，就能訂婚，椿小米，然後進行婚禮。

gloss: 做-實現-名物化-訂婚-名物化

free: #e If (two families) (want) to engage and get married, (they) will first discuss about the dowry.
#c 若(雙方)想訂婚與結婚，(他們)首先要互相討論聘禮。
#e The dowry is different for nobles, civilians, and non-eldest sons.
#c 貴族、平民、非長子的聘禮不同。
#e So for necessity, the dowry, there are nobles’, non-eldest sons’, and civilians’.
#c 所以聘禮必需品有貴族用，非長子用，及平民用。
#e The dowry will be used for the wedding.
#c 這聘禮就是用於結婚。
#e The recent dowry is wood.
#c 現在的聘禮就是木材。
#e The male must at first lumber the wood.
#c 男生要先砍樹。
#e There must be food.
#c 要有吃的東西。
#e The food contains pork.
#c 吃的東西有豬肉。
#e The pork must be rump and sirloin.
#c 豬肉必須是腿肉或五花肉。
#e There must be rice cake.
#c 要有米糕。
#e There must be millet liquor.
#c 要有小米酒。
#e These are very important.
#c 這些很重要。
#e The following needs the betel nut, millet liquor, and other food.
#c 還會有檳榔、小米酒等其他吃的東西。
#e These are called dowry.
#c 這些就叫聘禮。
#e The dowry must be put down first.
#c 聘禮一定要先拿下來。
#e Dowry must be new if (it) is put down.
#c 聘禮要是新的如果(它)被放下。
#e The dowry, there will must be wood.
#c 聘禮，一定會要有木頭。
#e There is also pork; they are exactly rump, sirloin, (and) neck.
#c 也要有豬肉，他們就是腿肉、五花肉、(和) 頸肉。
#e Then there are rice cake; then there are millet; then there are liquor; then there are betel nut; (and) there are lime.
#c 然後要有米糕；有小米酒；有檳榔；有石灰。

gloss: 狀態.實現-有能力=第二人稱單數.附著主格
使役-名物化-重疊-重疊-招待-名物化

free: #e You will be capable of all the treatment; then put down this…put down these necessities.
#c 你要能盡所有款待之物，然後放下這些...這些必需品。
#e This is the “dowry” in Taiwanese.
#c 這就是台灣人所謂的「聘禮」。

gloss: 狀態.實現-重疊-重要=完成

free: #e It has been very important: that the noble’s dowry the civilian’s dowry are different.
#c 很重要的是：貴族和平民聘禮不同。
#e First, if (you) want to put down the necessity, and (there must be) machete and iron pot .
#c 首先，若要放下聘禮，(要有)山刀跟鐵鍋。
#e machete and iron pot.
#c 鍋子跟刀。
#e First, Clay pots for nobles, Noble must have the clay pot which contains two things: singisingane and nivalrivalringuvane.
#c 首先，貴族有陶壺，貴族要有兩個東西，singisingane 跟 nivalrivalringuvane。

gloss: 是平民=第二人稱單數.附著主格

free: #e If you are a civilian, (you have) this in the upper part.
#c 如果你是平民，你就會有上面的這個。
#e This is noble’s clay pot; this is civilian clay pot.
#c 這是貴族陶壺這是平民陶壺。
#e There must be this; there must be a necklace.
#c 一定要有這個；一定要有項鍊。
#e The necklace which given to the nobles is made of rerethane.
#c 給貴族的項鍊用rerethane做成。
#e Civilians need to give one of this.
#c 平民要給這個。
#n 此時發音人手指一物
#e The civilians, this…There are shoulder belts for the civilians.
#c 這平民呢，這個…這裡有平民用的肩帶。
#n 發音人手指向櫃子裡的肩帶。
#e (Civilians) use this shoulder belt.
#c (平民)用這肩帶。
#n 發音人手指向櫃子裡的肩帶。
#e (Civilians) use this head bend.
#c (平民)用這頭飾。
#n 發音人手指向櫃子裡的頭飾。

gloss: 第二人稱複數.自由斜格
脫下=第一人稱單數.附著主格
free: #e This wedding dress is not to give you; I put it off and give (it) to you.
#c 這結婚禮服不是要送你們的，是我脫下(它)給你們的。
#n 此句暗喻結婚禮服之珍貴
#e Then (I) put off this wedding dress.
#c 然後(我)脫下這件結婚禮服。
#n KAIDU 語義不定，在巴冷公主故事中是「不要」的意思，需再確認。

gloss: 狀態.實現-重疊-富有=第二人稱單數.附著主格

free: #e There is also land (in the dowry), if you were rich; you (put) land together.
#c 如果你很富有，(聘禮)也可以一併有土地。

gloss: 靈魂=第三人稱複數.附著屬格
力量=第三人稱複數.附著屬格
free: #e The nobles, their spirit and their power are different.
#c 這貴族，他們的靈魂與他們的力量不同。

gloss: 重疊-給=第三人稱單數.附著屬格

free: #e There are giving (including) this rivers and hunting fields.
#c 有給河川跟獵場的。
#e If (you are) the eldest son of nobles, (you) can give the river and hunting field together.
#c 只有(你是)當家的頭目，(你)能給河川與獵場。
#e There are this kind of nobles.
#c 有這種貴族。
#e if (you are) a civilian, (you) can’t do this.
#c 如果(你是)平民，(你)不能這樣做。
#e That is needed to be known.
#c 那是要知道的。

gloss: 狀態.實現-狀態-重要=完成

free: #e The most important thing is that the first thing being put down from the dowry is the corona in wedding.
#c 婚禮中最重要的事就是聘禮中第一件要被放下之物是花冠。
#e it must be that the highest head band of the bribe, not the groom in that day.
#c 一定是這樣當天新郎，不是新娘最高的頭飾。
#e (There are) sometimes two, sometimes three.
#c 有時(有)兩個，有時三個。
#e (She) put the fur.
#c (她)放羽毛。
#e The female need to put the fur in the head bend.
#c 女生要放羽毛在頭飾裡
#n這句需再確認，沒有使役者。
#e The leader must put (the fur) (into the head bend)
#c 頭目一定要放(羽毛)(在頭飾裡)。
#e Traditionally, the woman must give and put the fur in the head bend.
#c 傳統上，女生要給並插羽毛在頭飾上。
#e She is a virgin, a pure woman.
#c 她是一個處女就一個聖潔的女人。
#n matemele要確認
#e The symbol of a virgin must be made by lily.
#c 純潔的女人的象徵一定是百合花做的。
#e Then a grasp of male eagle fur is for the noble or elders.
#c 然後雄鷹羽毛一把給貴族或老人。
#e (Then a grasp of male eagle fur) is for the noble or elders.
#c (然後雄鷹羽毛一把)給貴族或老人。
#e If the Rukai person is pure, (s/he) will do this.
#c 如果是純潔的魯凱族人，(他/她)能做這個。
#e Only virgin and those engaged in public can have holy wedding ceremony.
#c 只有處女跟公開交往的男女能有聖潔的婚禮。

gloss: 複數-T-母親=第三人稱單數.附著屬格
free: #e (You) are being privately criticized or not agree by parents
#c (你)被人私下談論或父母親不答應。
#e (Those) who commit suicide for frustrated love or elope will have no such a wedding ceremony.
#c 殉情或是私奔(的人)沒有這樣的一個婚禮。
#e it will be like this: there will be no dowry and there will be no other items.
#c 這樣就會沒有聘禮或沒有其他東西。
#e When (they) mutually accept this, (they) should dance.
#c 若(他們)互相同意這個後，(他們)就要跳舞。
#e It is that when the ceremony takes place, everyone in the tribe should wear traditional costume; (they) join the wedding and dance.
#c 就是到了慶典那天，部落裡的男女老幼都要穿傳統服飾參加典禮並跳舞。
#e (They) dance, (and) they (need) to escort the female and return.
#c (他們)跳舞，要護送女生並回家。
#n 這裡的跳”完”，須再確認。
#e To Rukai people, the escorting is very important.
#c 對魯凱人來說，護送是很重要的。
#e There is an old Rukai custom called “grab marriage.”
#c 魯凱族從前有一個叫做搶婚的習俗。
#e Rukai people stress on the chastity of woman.
#c 魯凱族人很重視女人的貞潔。
#e Rukai people stress on the chastity of woman and celibate.
#c 魯凱族人很重視女人的貞潔和守貞的文化。

gloss: 狀態.未實現-走開=第一人稱複數(排除).附著主格.主格
free: #e When we leave, (we) should carry the female.
#c 當我們離開時，(我們)要帶女生走。
#e Wrap cloth is used when the female is sent to the male’s house; it is worn to protect the private part of body.
#c 裹身布用在女生被送到男方家裡時，穿著它把重點部位保護住。
#e This is cloth-wrapping.
#c 這就是裹身。
#e If (she) come to the male’s place
#c 如果來(到)男方這邊。
#e The grab marriage is not what people are talking about now: man and woman mutually accept, and enter the house to get laid.
#c 搶婚不是像現在人所說的男女談好了就能進房睡覺。
#e Because the woman is wearing the wrap cloth for private-part protection, when the coupe is sent into the room, the man must unwrap those things with bare hands.
#c 因為女生身上穿有保護三點的裹身布，所以將一男一女送入房間後，男生一定要用空手把這些東西解開。
#e Because the wrapping is too solid, sometimes it takes three to four days for the couple to get laid.
#c 因為裹身很緊密，有時會要到三四天小倆口才能同寢。
#e The couples sleep.
#c 兩人同寢。
#e Elders say that if (the male) does not remove the wrap cloth, (the woman) should not remove the kalathesu when (they) wake up.
#c 老人家囑咐若男生沒有解開裹身布，則(他們)起床時女生不要把kalathesu拿下來。
#n kalathesu為一種手環。

gloss: 複數-媽媽=第三人稱單數.附著屬格
名物化-解開-衣服-名物化
free: #e When the female elders know that the couple didn’t make it last night, (the couple) has to try to remove the cloth again at night until the male unwrap the cloth.
#c 當女性長者知道小倆口沒有完事，則(兩人)晚上時就必須重來解開衣服直到裹身布解開為止。
#n 女性長者在婚禮結束後會在新人房外待命，檢查男方是否解開布料。
#e When the couples finished, (they) formed a family (and) then (they) should hold a banquet the next day.
#c 當小倆口完成以後(他們)就組成了家庭，(他們)第二天要宴請賓客。

gloss: TU-實現-停止.說=第一人稱單數.附著主格
free: #e This is the wedding ceremony of Rukai; I stopped saying here.
#c 這就是魯凱的結婚典禮，我說到這裡。
